skill.name: daily-ai-news
skill.description: Aggregates and summarizes the latest AI news from multiple sources including AI news websites and web search. Provides concise news briefs with direct links to original articles. Activates when user asks for 'today's AI news', 'AI updates', 'latest AI developments', or mentions wanting a 'daily AI briefing'.
skill.summary: Aggregates and summarizes the latest AI news from multiple sources including AI news websites and we...
skill.author: Claude-meta-skill Community

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. All functionality is achieved through platform-provided MCP tools (web_reader, WebSearch) that users invoke through natural language. No file system access, no environment variables, no external commands, and no persistence mechanisms.

content.value_statement: Stay informed about the latest artificial intelligence developments without searching multiple sources. This skill aggregates news from trusted AI publications and presents organized briefings with summaries and direct links.
actual_capabilities: Aggregates AI news from major publications like VentureBeat, TechCrunch, and MIT Technology Review
Uses web search with date filters to find recent AI developments
Organizes news into 5 categories: Major Announcements, Research, Industry, Tools, and Policy
Provides formatted briefings with headlines, summaries, and original article links
Supports follow-up questions to dive deeper into specific stories
Customizes output by depth level, time range, and topic focus
limitations: Does not provide real-time breaking news alerts
Cannot access paywalled content beyond available excerpts
Relies on external sources which may have reporting delays
Cannot predict future AI announcements or developments

use_cases.title: Morning News Roundup
use_cases.description: Get a quick overview of overnight AI developments before starting your workday

use_cases.title: Research Paper Tracker
use_cases.description: Stay updated on new AI papers and academic breakthroughs from arXiv and conferences

use_cases.title: Industry Intelligence
use_cases.description: Track AI funding announcements, partnerships, and market trends affecting your business

prompt_templates.title: Daily Briefing
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me today's AI news. What are the most important developments?

prompt_templates.title: Research Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: What new AI research papers were published this week? Focus on breakthroughs and novel techniques.

prompt_templates.title: Company Update
prompt_templates.prompt: What has OpenAI announced recently? Any new model releases or feature updates?

prompt_templates.title: Deep Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a detailed AI news briefing covering the last 3 days. Include analysis of market trends and significant announcements.

output: Major Announcements: OpenAI releases new GPT model with enhanced reasoning capabilities
Research: New paper demonstrates 40% efficiency improvement in transformer inference
Industry: AI startup secures $50M funding for enterprise automation tools
Policy: EU proposes new AI safety regulations requiring transparency reporting

best_practices: Specify your preferred time range to get the most relevant news for your needs
Ask follow-up questions to get deeper analysis on stories that interest you
Request specific formats (brief, standard, or deep) based on how much time you have
anti_patterns: Asking for news without any time frame may return irrelevant older content
Requesting too many categories at once can result in superficial coverage
Expecting real-time breaking news instead of daily digest

faq.question: What sources does this skill use?
faq.answer: It aggregates from major AI publications including VentureBeat, TechCrunch, The Verge, MIT Technology Review, and company blogs.

faq.question: How recent is the news?
faq.answer: By default, it covers the last 24 hours. You can request longer time ranges like last 3 days or week.

faq.question: Can I focus on specific topics?
faq.answer: Yes. You can request research papers only, industry news, product launches, or updates from specific companies.

faq.question: Is my data collected or stored?
faq.answer: No. This skill only uses web search and reading tools to fetch publicly available news. No personal data is collected.

faq.question: Why are some links broken or inaccessible?
faq.answer: Some sources may have paywalls or the content may have been removed. The skill notes these limitations when encountered.

faq.question: How is this different from a regular web search?
faq.answer: This skill curates and summarizes AI news specifically, filters duplicates, organizes by category, and provides formatted briefings.
